Gamepad.summary: The Gamepad interface of the Gamepad API defines an individual gamepad or other controller, allowing access to information such as button presses, axis positions, and id.

remarks.para: A Gamepad object can be returned in one of two ways: via the gamepad property of the and events, or by grabbing any position in the array returned by the method.

blockquote.para: The support of gamepad features varies across different combinations of platforms and controllers. Even if the controller supports a certain feature (for example, haptic feedback), the platform may not support it for that controller.

GamepadVibrationActuator.summary: The vibrationActuator read-only property of the interface returns a object, which represents haptic feedback hardware available on the controller.

blockquote.para: Support for this property may vary across different combinations of platforms and controllers. Even if the controller supports haptic feedback, the platform may not support it.

GamepadIndex.summary:
The Gamepad.index property of the
interface returns an integer that is auto-incremented to be unique for each device
currently connected to the system.

remarks.para:
This can be used to distinguish multiple controllers; a gamepad that is disconnected
and reconnected will retain the same index.

GamepadMapping.summary:
The Gamepad.mapping property of the
interface returns a string indicating whether the browser has
remapped the controls on the device to a known layout.

GamepadConnected.summary:
The Gamepad.connected property of the
interface returns a boolean indicating whether the gamepad is
still connected to the system.

remarks.para:
If the gamepad is connected, the value is true; if not, it is
false.

GamepadPose.summary: NOTE Experimental The pose read-only property of the interface returns a object representing the pose information associated with a WebVR controller (e.g., its position and orientation in 3D space).

GamepadHand.summary: NOTE Experimental The hand read-only property of the interface returns an enum defining what hand the controller is being held in, or is most likely to be held in.

GamepadButtons.summary: The buttons property of the interface returns an array of objects representing the buttons present on the device.

remarks.para: Each entry in the array is 0 if the button is not pressed, and non-zero (typically 1.0) if the button is pressed.

GamepadDisplayId.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The displayId read-only property of the interface returns the of the associated — the VRDisplay that the gamepad is controlling the displayed scene of.

There is no direct replacement for this property. The object associated with an can be obtained using the property.

GamepadDisplayId.value: A number representing the associated . If the number is 0, then the gamepad is not associated with a VR display.

GamepadHapticActuators.summary: NOTE Experimental The hapticActuators read-only property of the interface returns an array containing objects, each of which represents haptic feedback hardware available on the controller.

GamepadId.summary:
The Gamepad.id property of the
interface returns a string containing some information about the controller.

remarks.para:
The exact syntax is not strictly specified, but in Firefox it will contain three pieces
of information separated by dashes (-):
For example, a PS2 controller returned 810-3-USB Gamepad.

This information is intended to allow you to find a mapping for the controls on the
device as well as display useful feedback to the user.

GamepadAxes.summary:
The Gamepad.axes property of the
interface returns an array representing the controls with axes present on the device
(e.g., analog thumb sticks).

remarks.para:
Each entry in the array is a floating point value in the range -1.0 – 1.0, representing
the axis position from the lowest value (-1.0) to the highest value (1.0).

GamepadTimestamp.summary:
The Gamepad.timestamp property of the
interface returns a
representing the last time the data for this gamepad was updated.

remarks.para:
The idea behind this is to allow developers to determine if the axes and
button data have been updated from the hardware. The value must be
relative to the navigationStart attribute of the
interface. Values are monotonically
increasing, meaning that they can be compared to determine the ordering of updates, as
newer values will always be greater than or equal to older values.

blockquote.para: This property is not currently supported anywhere.
